intro: Conocephalus forbesii, commonly known as the Forbes' conocephalus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, three-lobed flowers. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in marshy areas along rivers and lakes. Due to its specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
